intro: Lepidaploa pallescens, commonly known as the pale lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, whitish bloom, giving it a silvery appearance. Lepidaploa pallescens produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
